Notes: Very easy to acquire from any metal supplier; extremely common and cheap.
Widely available; often used for shafts and tooling—slightly higher cost but still common.
Common stainless; very easy to find, widely stocked, good corrosion resistance.
More corrosion‑resistant than 304; available but slightly more expensive.
Extremely common; highly available, cheap, and easy to machine.
Common free‑machining brass; available at many suppliers but more expensive than steel.
Common high‑conductivity copper; easy to find but price varies with market.
Available but expensive; typically purchased from specialty suppliers.
Common for machine bases; very cheap and available but brittle and messy to machine.
High‑performance alloy; very expensive and usually only from specialty distributors.
